ATTACKS & SPELLCASTING:
Fighting Style: Blind fighting
 - Blindsight up to a range of 10 ft

Action Surge: 
 - Once per short rest, gain additional action

Second Wind (BA): 
 - Once per short rest, heal 1d10 + fighter level (6)

Extra Attack: 
 - Attack twice (thrice, unleash incarnation)

Echo knight:
 - Swap places as BA
 - Attack from main or echo
 - Echo has reaction attack
 - Make additional attack from echo, CON times
FEATURES & TRAITS:
=====ASI=====
Feat: Shadow Touched
 - CHA +1, Learn invisibility and disguise self, cast once each. 

Feat: Telepathic
 - CHA + 1, You can speak telepathically to any creature that can understand you. Learn detect thoughts, cast once.  

Feat: Sentinel
When opp attack hits, their speed becomes 0, disengage wont work, when enemy attacks ally reaction attack.

ASI: CHA - CON
 - CHA + 1, CON + 1 


=====Fighter=====
Fighting Style: Blind fighting
 - Blindsight up to a range of 10 ft.

Action Surge: 
 - Once per short rest, gain additional action.

Second Wind: 
 - Once per short rest, heal 1d10 + fighter level.

Extra Attack: 
 - Attack twice.

Manifest Echo:
 -  BA: Manifest echo within 15 ft, see echo statistics.


=====Warlock=====
Invocations:
 - Investment of Chain Master
 - Gift of the Ever-Living Ones
 - Eldritch Mind

Pact of the Chain:
 - You learn find familiar and this familar can take special forms.

Hexblade's Curse:
 - You learn hexblade's curse

Hex Warrior:
 - You can attack with CHA instead of STR

Grave Touched:
 - You don’t need to eat, drink, or breathe. Once during each of your turns, when you hit a creature with an attack replace damage type with necrotic. You can roll one additional damage die when determining the necrotic damage the target takes. (Undead warlock, as hollow one)

CHARACTER NOTES:
Voice of the Chain Master:
You can communicate telepathically with your familiar and perceive through your familiar's senses as long as you are on the same plane of existence. Additionally, while perceiving through your familiar's senses, you can also speak through your familiar in your own voice, even if your familiar is normally incapable of speech.

Gift of the Ever-Living Ones:
 - Whenever you regain hit points while your familiar is within 100 feet of you, treat any dice rolled to determine the hit points you regain as having rolled their maximum value for you.

Eldritch Mind:
 - You have advantage on Constitution saving throws that you make to maintain your concentration on a spell.

Ghostly Gaze
 - As an action, you gain the ability to see through solid objects to a range of 30 feet. Within that range. This special sight lasts for 1 minute. During that time, you perceive objects as ghostly, transparent images.

lookupresult0,0:
Hex
Level: 1
Casting Time: 1 Bonus Action
Range: 90 ft
Components: V,S,M
Duration: Concentration, 1 Hour

 You place a curse on a creature that you can see within range. Until the spell ends, you deal an extra ld6 necrotic damage to the target whenever you hit it with an attack. Also, choose one ability when you cast the spell. The target has disadvantage on ability checks made with the chosen ability. If the target drops to 0 hit points before this spell ends, you can use a bonus action on a subsequent turn of yours to curse a new creature. A remove curse cast on the target ends this spell early. At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd or 4th level, you can maintain your concentration on the spell for up to 8 hours. When you use a spell slot of 5th level or higher, you can maintain your concentration on the spell for up to 24 hours.
lookupresult0,1:
Darkness
Level: 2
Casting Time: 1 Action
Range: 60 ft
Components: V,M
Duration: Concentration, 10 Minutes

 Magical darkness spreads from a point you choose within range to fill a 15-foot-radius sphere for the duration. The darkness spreads around corners. A creature with darkvision can't see through this darkness, and nonmagical light can't illuminate it.
 
 If the point you choose is on an object you are holding or one that isn't being worn or carried, the darkness emanates from the object and moves with it. Completely covering the source of the darkness with an opaque object, such as a bowl or a helm, blocks the darkness.
 
 If any of this spell's area overlaps with an area of light created by a spell of 2nd level or lower, the spell that created the light is dispelled.
lookupresult1,0:
detect thoughts
Level: 2
Casting Time: 1 Action
Range: Self
Components: V,S,M
Duration: Concentration, 1 Minute

 For the duration, you can read the thoughts of certain creatures. When you cast the spell and as your action on each turn until the spell ends, you can focus your mind on any one creature that you can see within 30 feet of you. If the creature you choose has an Intelligence of 3 or lower or doesn't speak any language, the creature is unaffected.
 
 You initially learn the surface thoughts of the creature--what is most on its mind in that moment. As an action, you can either shift your attention to another creature's thoughts or attempt to probe deeper into the same creature's mind. If you probe deeper, the target must make a Wisdom saving throw. If it fails, you gain insight into its reasoning (if any), its emotional state, and something that looms large in its mind (such as something it worries over, loves, or hates). If it succeeds, the spell ends. Either way, the target knows that you are probing into its mind, and unless you shift your attention to another creature's thoughts, the creature can use its action on its turn to make an Intelligence check contested by your Intelligence check; if it succeeds, the spell ends.
 
 Questions verbally directed at the target creature naturally shape the course of its thoughts, so this spell is particularly effective as part of an interrogation.
 
 You can also use this spell to detect the presence of thinking creatures you can't see. When you cast the spell or as your action during the duration, you can search for thoughts within 30 feet of you. The spell can penetrate barriers, but 2 feet of rock, 2 inches of any metal other than lead, or a thin sheet of lead blocks you. You can't detect a creature with an Intelligence of 3 or lower or one that doesn't speak any language.
 
 Once you detect the presence of a creature in this way, you can read its thoughts for the rest of the duration as described above, even if you can't see it, but it must still be within range.
lookupresult1,1:
Haste
Level: 3
Casting Time: 1 Action
Range: 30 ft
Components: V,S,M
Duration: Concentration, 1 Minute

 Choose a willing creature that you can see within range. Until the spell ends, the target's speed is doubled, it gains a +2 bonus to AC, it has advantage on Dexterity saving throws, and it gains an additional action on each of its turns. That action can be used only to take the Attack (one weapon attack only), Dash, Disengage, Hide, or Use an Object action.
 
 When the spell ends, the target can't move or take actions until after its next turn, as a wave of lethargy sweeps over it.

treasures2:
- Void Gazers (Rare) (attunement)
These onyx gemstone spheres appear to be nothing other than regular gems. A creature can attune to these gems by placing them in their eye sockets and replacing their own eyes, permanently blinding them. When attuned to, the wearer can command them to emenate darkness, as if the darkness spell was cast on them, this ability can be used once per long rest.

 - Nightfallen (Uncommon) (attunement)
This +2 scythe transforms into an innocent looking walking cane when a magic phrase is spoken, and reverts to a scythe with another phrase. The blade of the scythe is made of a black, obsidian like material, it exudes a black mist and faint whispers are heard when up close. 
(My Hexblade)(Heavy, Two-Handed (Greatsword))

BACKSTORY:
Pact with the chained oblivion broken in an ritual granted by serenrae. Keeper of the moontides is mijn nieuwe patron. Zijn domain is de Whispering Tree

Corrupted Darkness
2nd-level evocation
Casting Time: 1 action
Range: 60 feet
Components: V, S (bat fur and a drop of pitch or piece of coal)
Duration: Concentration, up to 1 minute
You conjure a sphere of shadowy energy that fills a 15-foot radius sphere centered on a point you choose within range. The area is covered in darkness and is considered difficult terrain. You designate a number of creatures equal to your proficiency bonus (minimum of 1) who are unaffected by this spell. These designated creatures can see normally in this darkness, and they are immune to its effects.
If the point you choose is on an object you are holding or one that isn’t being worn or carried, the darkness emanates from the object and moves with it. If any of this spell’s area overlaps with an area of light created by a spell of 2nd level or lower, the spell that created the light is dispelled.
When a creature that is not designated enters the area for the first time on its turn or starts its turn there, it must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a success, it becomes immune to the psychic effects of Corrupted Darkness for 1 minute. On a failure, the creature is consumed by horrific visions from the Far Realm, taking 2d10 psychic damage at the start of each of its turns while it remains in the area.
Additionally, any creatures within the area of Corrupted Darkness, including those designated by the caster, may experience unpredictable effects determined by the DM.
